rows.name: text_top_1
rows.value:
Draw a tic-tac-toe grid big enough to hold a Shape Card in each square. Choose 8 of the Shape Cards that have two of each property. For example, pick the 8 cards that are either a triangle or square, have one or two figures, and are either red or blue. Place these 8 cards around the outside of the board.

Players take turns picking an unused card for their opponent to place on the board. The first player to place a card that completes 3 cards in a row which have at least one property in common wins!  If all the cards are played without a winner, it's a tie game. Here are some examples of ways to win:

rows.name: text_bottom_1
rows.value: Simplify the game and add an element of luck by placing the cards face down and having each player play the top card.
